<MembersIndexItem
  type="namespace"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a></>}>
This is an optimization pass for GlobalISel generic memory operations. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#details">More...</a>

## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager">SectionMemoryManager</a></>}>
This is a simple memory manager which implements the methods called by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> class to allocate memory for section-based loading of objects, usually those generated by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> execution engine. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/memorymapper">MemoryMapper</a></>}>
Implementations of this interface are used by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager">SectionMemoryManager</a> to request pages from the operating system. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/memorymapper/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/freememblock">FreeMemBlock</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/memorygroup">MemoryGroup</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a simple memory manager which implements the methods called by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the RuntimeDyld class to allocate memory for section-based loading of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// objects, usually those generated by the MCJIT execution engine.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This memory manager allocates all section memory as read-write.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// RuntimeDyld will copy JITed section memory into these allocated blocks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and perform any necessary linking and relocations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Any client using this memory manager MUST ensure that section-specific</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// page permissions have been applied before attempting to execute functions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in the JITed object.  Permissions can be applied either by calling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MCJIT::finalizeObject or by calling SectionMemoryManager::finalizeMemory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// directly.  Clients of MCJIT should call MCJIT::finalizeObject.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method attempts to allocate \\p NumBytes bytes of virtual memory for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Purpose.  \\p NearBlock may point to an existing allocation, in which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// case an attempt is made to allocate more memory near the existing block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The actual allocated address is not guaranteed to be near the requested</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// address.  \\p Flags is used to set the initial protection flags for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// block of the memory.  \\p EC &#91;out&#93; returns an object describing any error</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// that occurs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method may allocate more than the number of bytes requested.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// actual number of bytes allocated is indicated in the returned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// MemoryBlock.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The start of the allocated block must be aligned with the system</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// allocation granularity (64K on Windows, page size on Linux).  If the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// address following \\p NearBlock is not so aligned, it will be rounded up</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// to the next allocation granularity boundary.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\r a non-null MemoryBlock if the function was successful, otherwise a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// null MemoryBlock with \\p EC describing the error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">sys::MemoryBlock</a></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This method sets the protection flags for a block of memory to the state</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// specified by \\p Flags.  The behavior is not specified if the memory was</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// not allocated using the allocateMappedMemory method.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Block describes the memory block to be protected.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// \\p Flags specifies the new protection state to be assigned to the block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// If \\p Flags is MF&#95;WRITE, the actual behavior varies with the operating</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// system (i.e. MF&#95;READ | MF&#95;WRITE on Windows) and the target architecture</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// (i.e. MF&#95;WRITE -&gt; MF&#95;READ | MF&#95;WRITE on i386).</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Allocates a memory block of (at least) the given size suitable for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// executable code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The value of \\p Alignment must be a power of two.  If \\p Alignment is zero</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a default alignment of 16 will be used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint8&#95;t &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#acfcf22eac937cf698005e9cc378cad73">allocateCodeSection</a>(uintptr&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Alignment,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Allocates a memory block of (at least) the given size suitable for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// executable code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The value of \\p Alignment must be a power of two.  If \\p Alignment is zero</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Update section-specific memory permissions and other attributes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method is called when object loading is complete and section page</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// permissions can be applied.  It is up to the memory manager implementation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to decide whether or not to act on this method.  The memory manager will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// typically allocate all sections as read-write and then apply specific</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// permissions when this method is called.  Code sections cannot be executed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// until this function has been called.  In addition, any cache coherency</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operations needed to reliably use the memory are also performed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns true if an error occurred, false otherwise.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#af06d61d7c637095c5b7270b34224c5dd">finalizeMemory</a>(std::string &#42;ErrMsg = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Invalidate instruction cache for code sections.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Some platforms with separate data cache and instruction cache require</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// explicit cache flush, otherwise JIT code manipulations (like resolved</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// relocations) will get to the data cache but not to the instruction cache.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method is called from finalizeMemory.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#a64835973f93c4f018aa377870e15ee97">invalidateInstructionCache</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The actual block of free memory</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If there is a pending allocation from the same reservation right before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this block, store it&#39;s index in PendingMem, to be able to update the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pending region if part of this block is allocated, rather than having to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">MemoryGroup &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PendingMem contains all blocks of memory (subblocks of AllocatedMem)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which have not yet had their permissions applied, but have been given</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// out to the user. FreeMem contains all block of memory, which have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
